required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatic Impairment Study for Lorlatinib in Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1 STUDY TO EVALUATE THE EFFECT OF HEPATIC IMPAIRMENT ON THE PHARMACOKINETICS AND SAFETY OF LORLATINIB IN ADVANCED CANCER PATIENTS

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1 study in advanced cancer patients with varied hepatic fucntions to evaluate the potential effect of hepatic impairment on pharmacokinetics and safety of lorlatinib and provide dose recommendation for patients with hepatic impairment if possible.

detailed_description.textblock:
This will be a Phase 1, open label, multi center, multiple dose, non randomized, Phase 1 clinical trial of lorlatinib in advanced cancer patients with varying degrees of hepatic impairment and necessary age , weight , and gender matched prospect normal hepatic function patients. This study is intended to evaluate the potential effect of hepatic impairments on the PK and safety of lorlatinib after daily administration of lorlatinib and to provide dosing recommendation for patients with varied degree of hepatic impairment if possible.
Patients in the study will be assigned to different groups (A1, normal liver function, control for group B; A2, normal liver function, control for group C; B, mild hepatic impairment; C, moderate hepatic impairment; D, severe hepatic impairment) according to their liver function. The enrollment of approximately 76 advanced cancer patients is anticipated in this study in order to have 8 PK-evaluable patients in each of Groups A1, A2, B and C, and 6 PK-evaluable patients in Group D for final statistical analysis. Evaluable patients are those who complete the planned PK sample collection on Cycle 2 Day 1 and have no lorlatinib dose modification until completion of Cycle 2 Day 1 PK evaluation. Patients who are not evaluable for PK will be replaced. Each patient will be treated with repeated oral once daily doses of lorlatinib in 21-day cycles until disease progression, patient refusal, or unacceptable toxicity occurs. The dose schedule may be modified as necessary for individual patients according to tolerability.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients in the study will be assigned to different groups according to their liver function. Patients in each group will receive specific lorlatinib dose. Plasma samples for pharmacokinetic analysis will be collected in all patients. Safety and efficacy will also be followed in all patients until at least 28 days after the last study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib AUC24 at steady state
primary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: area under plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to dosing interval of 24 hours (AUC24) at steady state on cycle 2 day 1

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib Cmax at steady state
primary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: observed maximal plasma concentration at steady state on cycle 2 day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib AUClast after single dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 1 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: area under plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) after single dose on cycle 1 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib Tlast after single dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 1 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: the time of the last quantifiable concentration (Tlast) after single dose on cycle 1 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib Tmax after single dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 1 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: the time to Cmax after single dose on cycle 1 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib Cmin at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: observed minimal plasma concentration at steady state on cycle 2 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib AUClast at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: area under plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) at steady state on cycle 2 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma lorlatinib Tlast at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: the time of the last quantifiable concentration (Tlast) at steady state on cycle 2 day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: lorlatinib CL/F at steadys state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: lorlatinib apparent clearance at steady state on cycle 2 day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: plasma lorlatinib metabolite AUC24 at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: cycle 2 day 1 up to 24 hours post lorlatinib dose (each cycle is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: area under plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to dosing interval of 24 hours (AUC24) at steady state on cycle 2 day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients experienced treatment emergent adverse event assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: until at least 28 days after the last lorlatinib dose
secondary_outcome.description: Type, incidence, severity, seriousness, and relationship to study medications of adverse events (AE) and any laboratory abnormalities

secondary_outcome.measure: ORR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline up to approximately 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: objective response rate (ORR) is defined as the percent of patients with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) based on investigator evaluation, according to RECIST v1.1 relative to the response-evaluable population

secondary_outcome.measure: DR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline up to approximately 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response (DR) will be measured from the date that an objective tumor response (CR or PR) is first documented (whichever occurs first) to date of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients experienced treatment related adverse event assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: until at least 28 days after the last lorlatinib dose
secondary_outcome.description: Type, incidence, severity, seriousness, and relationship to study medications of adverse events (AE) and any laboratory abnormalities

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients experienced treatment emergent serious adverse event assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: until at least 28 days after the last lorlatinib dose
secondary_outcome.description: Type, incidence, severity, seriousness, and relationship to study medications of adverse events (AE) and any laboratory abnormalities

arm_group.description: continued daily administration of lorlatinib in patients with normal hepatic function
continued daily administration of lorlatinib in patients with normal hepatic function
continued daily administration of lorlatinib in patients with mild hepatic imapirment
continued daily administration of lorlatinib in patients with moderate hepatic impairment
continued daily administration of lorlatinib in patients with severe hepatic impairment

intervention.description: continued daily administration of 100 mg lorlatinib
continued daily administration of lorlatinib at the dose level same as Group C for the first 22 days and 100 mg QD afterwards
continued daily administration of 100 mg QD lorlatinib
continued daily administration of lorlatinib at 50 mg QD initially and may be adjusted based on PK and safety results from the initial several patients
continued daily administration of lorlatinib at the dose level determined based on preliminary PK and safety results from first several patients in Group C

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
